author: Ben Leubsdorf
title: U.S. Retail Sales Declined 0.3% in January
text:
WASHINGTON—Spending at U.S. retailers dropped in January, signaling a weak start to the year for consumers despite low unemployment and rising wages.
Retail and food-services sales—a measure of consumer spending at U.S. stores, restaurants and websites—declined a seasonally adjusted 0.3% in January from the prior month, the Commerce Department said Wednesday.
